thread.title: Somber dedication of Oakland mural at which artist was slain
thread.title_full: Somber dedication of Oakland mural at which artist was slain - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Jenna Lyons
title: Somber dedication of Oakland mural at which artist was slain
text:
Photo: Paul Chinn, The Chronicle Leano Rice, brother of slain muralist Antonio Ramos, gives a passionate speech at a dedication ceremony for the Superheroes Mural Project on West Street in Oakland, Calif. on Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015. Antonio Ramos was shot and killed while working on the mural on Sept. 29. Leano Rice, brother of slain muralist Antonio Ramos, gives a...
Despite the bright colors of the newly completed mural below an overpass on Interstate 580 in Oakland, Wednesday was somber for the friends and relatives of Antonio Ramos, one of the muralists on the project, who died Sept. 29 after a scuffle on the job turned deadly. Leano Rice, brother of slain muralist Antonio Ramos, gives a passionate speech at a dedication ceremony for the Superheroes Mural Project on West Street in Oakland, Calif. on Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015. Antonio Ramos was shot and killed while working on the mural on Sept. 29. Leano Rice, brother of slain muralist Antonio Ramos, gives a...
Despite the bright colors of the newly completed mural below an overpass on Interstate 580 in Oakland, Wednesday was somber for the friends and relatives of Antonio Ramos, one of the muralists on the project, who died Sept. 29 after a scuffle on the job turned deadly.
